header.title: ageism and bullying in the tech industry
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: While I love my profession I have had some experiences with ageism and bullying since I joined the workforce and that's what I'm talking about today. I do not mention the names of any people or employers in this video and will not give out that information. . ---. If you are new here, thanks for checking out my channel! I hope you'll stick around to see more by subscribing. I'm Keeks and I make music, reviews, storytimes and commentary videos. . . instagram: . outfits + personal posts: @sketchii . music recommendations: @albumjournal. my own music: @keana. . join the discord server: https://discord.gg/ptPrtSy. ask me a question: https://goo.gl/forms/a2S6df7pWeMDBfxs1

commentThread.commentText: The tech industry is shit filled with 20 and 30-something gatekeepers that think they are smarter than everybody else but are really just f.cking geeks. I have worked with plenty of these kooks. They all look and sound the same. Alot of tech jobs aren't even very difficult.

this is such a problem that big companies
  get away with and it needs to brought to light
Ugh. It sounds like that first woman was just such a bully. I hate when people take advantage of their power.

replies.commentText: Honestly yeah, she totally was. Even recording this video I was scared people would say I overreacted. Thanks for letting me know it was legit Gigi 💚

@offbeat kiki it hardly sounded like you reacted at all! Those bullies do that because they can get away with it and typically the only actions you can take in those situations make things worse. They want you to break so they can gaslight the shit out of you. It's honestly terrifying some people operate like that. The fact that you recognized what was going on and maintained a degree of composure in the workplace is commendable.

May you never have to deal with anyone like that ever again!
@Michael thank you for the kind words! I did my best given the hostile situation. I definitely did feel like anything I did would make it worse.

commentThread.commentText: Hey, I'm sorry you had to go through all of this! Just out of curiosity, have you ever shared your less accessible music at work, and has it gone over well? Based on this video and past comments, your coworkers don't seem to be very open-minded, so I don't think it would go over very well :(. As for a video on how you got your job, yes, I would love to see it!

replies.commentText: Hey! Actually I do at least work with one person who knows the artists I talk about but they're not super into it. Before the whole layoff ordeal I knew a few people who were cool hipster weirdos and liked similar music, we would trade songs and take turns DJing. I got to pick the music at team gatherings usually. That was the only time I'd worked with people who were anything like me though. It really is just a matter of chance.

offbeat kiki That sounds awesome :)
I hope I'll get to have awesome co-workers like that one day!

commentThread.commentText: Watch you since you had 100 subscribers and you're still the BEST.

replies.commentText: Wow thank you so much for tuning in for the last two years! Hugs!

commentThread.commentText: hi i found your channel recently and i love it keep up the good work

replies.commentText: Thanks for checking my channel out!! <3

commentThread.commentText: I can't believe stuff like this happens

replies.commentText: I couldn't believe it either at the time! I really try to be nice and treat others well in the workplace :/
